conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval from 0 to \( t_2 \), we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph for object B.
The graph for object B is the curve that starts at the origin and increases over time.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time. On a v-t graph, acceleration is represented by the slope of the velocity-time curve.
At the beginning (0 to \( t_1 \)), the slope of the curve for object B is negative, indicating that the velocity is decreasing (negative acceleration).
As time progresses from \( t_1 \) to \( t_2 \), the slope of the curve becomes less negative and eventually becomes positive, indicating that the velocity is increasing (positive acceleration).

premise: The slope of the curve for object B changes from negative to positive as time increases from 0 to \( t_2 \).
conclusion: This indicates that the acceleration of object B is increasing over this time interval.

premise: Initially, the acceleration is negative, and it becomes less negative and eventually positive as time progresses.
conclusion: The acceleration of B first decreases and then increases.
